title: The Asset Allocator: Commodity Spike Was Foreseeable
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: Corn prices have jumped to a three-year high amid extreme wet weather. USDA data two months ago that suggested there was nothing to worry about today confirm that there was something to worry about. This brief podcast (3:37) argues that the key issue of concern to investors amidst this commodity spike is inflation protection. Owning commodity futures is one way to hedge this risk; those uninterested in fine-tuning their portfolios could rely on cash and gold to get them through the market’s tantrums.   Learn more about your ad choices.
